decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing card draw and card advantage to pull ahead. The key strategy revolves around generating value from Monastery Mentor and leveraging its ability to create Monk tokens. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stony Silence and Fragmentize. The powerful planeswalkers Dack Fayden and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy provide additional card advantage and versatility to help maintain control over the game.

This vintage deck focuses on using Monastery Mentor and Monastery Mentor to control the game by disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with draw spells. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset Transcendent to help maintain control of the game. The deck's mana base is built to support its color requirements and includes powerful lands like Library of Alexandria and Strip Mine to further establish its control over the game.

The deck focuses on playing disruptive Eldrazi creatures that can come out quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the game through disruptive abilities. The deck also includes disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to further impede the opponent's strategy. With a focus on efficient creatures and disruption, this Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to overwhelm and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thorn of Amethyst and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game using cards like Containment Priest and Eldrazi Displacer to slow down the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful mana acceleration cards like Ancient Tomb and Sol Ring to play threats ahead of schedule and overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using efficient spells and card advantage, while building up a board presence with Monastery Mentor. By using cheap spells like Gitaxian Probe, Mental Misstep, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to protect its Mentor and create a swarm of Monk tokens. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Gush and Dig Through Time to maintain a steady stream of resources. Overall, the deck combines control elements with a strong win condition in Monastery Mentor to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes a "standstill" strategy, forcing both players to stop playing cards to draw cards, giving the control player an advantage. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain card advantage and extra turns. Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland are included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Moat and Stony Silence offer additional protection and disruption.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells and efficient threats to dominate the opponent. The key strategy revolves around leveraging the card advantage from Monastery Mentor and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a suite of counterspells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Pyroblast, this deck aims to control the game tempo and protect its key threats. Utilizing cards like Gitaxian Probe and Preordain for card selection and manipulation adds consistency to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal, and lock-down effects like Stony Silence. Monastery Mentor serves as the win condition, creating an army of prowess tokens while also benefiting from spells like Gush and Gitaxian Probe. The deck utilizes powerful Vintage restricted cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall to gain huge advantages in card advantage and mana efficiency. The mana base includes dual lands for fixing and disruption with Wasteland and Strip Mine. Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Dack Fayden provide card advantage and selection to ensure the deck's consistency.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through fast mana artifacts and land acceleration, while also playing powerful draw spells to find key combo pieces. The deck aims to create a loop of casting Paradoxical Outcome to bounce and replay artifacts for mana and card draw, eventually leading to a storm count high enough to win the game with Tendrils of Agony. It also includes disruption tools like Force of Will and Defense Grid to protect the combo. The key strategy is to efficiently generate mana, draw cards, and assemble the combo pieces to win quickly.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Control - Monastery deck utilizes powerful blue and white spells, along with the Monastery Mentor and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy creatures, to control the game and generate value. With plenty of counterspells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap, along with card draw from Gush and Preordain, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. Additionally, cards like Dack Fayden and Stony Silence provide additional disruption and advantage, making it a versatile and flexible control deck with strong win conditions.

The deck focuses on using aggressive artifact creatures and disruption to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing fast mana acceleration like the Moxen and Sol Ring, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, Thorn of Amethyst, and Warping Wail further disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Hangarback Walker and Arcbound Ravager provide additional threats with modular capabilities. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while applying pressure to swiftly close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By running efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, along with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Gush, the deck aims to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Force of Will. The inclusion of cards like Null Rod and Sudden Shock further disrupts the opponent's ability to develop their board, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and control. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck aims to control the game through a combination of counter spells and efficient card draw while using Monastery Mentor as a win condition to create a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with Monk tokens. The deck also utilizes artifacts like Mox Opal and fast mana to power out its spells quickly, allowing it to stay ahead in the tempo game. The inclusion of Paradoxical Outcome enables the deck to generate card advantage and tempo by bouncing back artifacts for more value.

The deck revolves around generating a massive amount of mana quickly using various mana artifacts and rituals, then assembling a lethal storm count with cards like Tendrils of Agony and Mind's Desire to deal a large amount of damage in a single turn. It also includes powerful draw and disruption cards such as Duress and Cabal Therapy to control the game and protect the combo. The goal is to storm off and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively, winning the game in one explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with counterspells, removal, and card draw while utilizing Oath of Druids as a win condition to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes various tutors and cantrips to find key pieces quickly and efficiently. The mana base is primarily blue and black with some green for ramp and card draw. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and overwhelm them with big threats like Emrakul once the Oath of Druids is activated.

The main objective of this Dredge combo deck is to use cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. By utilizing cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below, the deck can bring back powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Dragonlord Kolaghan from the graveyard for a game-winning attack. Cabal Therapy and Vengeful Pharaoh help control the opponent's board while Mindbreak Trap and Force of Will provide protection against disruption. The deck thrives on quickly filling the graveyard and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.
